answers.answer: Hi,Yes,fibromyalgia is an important factor in your aunt's symptoms .I suggest that she has this followed up closely by her physician.The headaches that she has been experiencing may be secondary to her underlying condition.It is important that you provide your aunt with the support and understanding that she needs right now. Fibromyalgia is a chronic pain condition.Is she being managed well?Psychological and pain management support are necessary.

question: MY AUNT HAS THESE BAD MIGRANES THAT LAST FOR DAYS AT A TIME. NOT ONLY THAT SHE HAS BEEN GETTING THESE SORES ON HER HEAD AND THIGHS, ANY RELATION? SHE DOES HAVE DIABETES AND FIBER  MALAYSIA. COULD THOSE BE A FACTOR?
title: MIGRAINES AND HEAD SORES?
